titles.title: Territorial Trade Enhancement Act
To ensure consultation with the governments of the territories of the United States with respect to trade policy and trade agreements.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

bill.summary: 5/6/2004--Introduced. Territorial Trade Enhancement Act - Amends the Trade Act of 1974 to require the President to consult with the: (1) governor of any State or U.S. territory before entering into trade agreements; and (2) governments of U.S. territories on trade policies, including those on trade in services.
